data.title: Dreaming of seeing the Cowboys in-person? Here's how much it costs to visit AT&T Stadium
data.meta_description: What fans need to know about Dallas Cowboys tickets, the 2024 Dallas Cowboy schedule, and travel accommodations.
data.text:
Every NFL fanbase starts the season with renewed hope, and the Dallas Cowboys may have the biggest fanbase — as illustrated by attendance numbers.

The Cowboys have dominated NFL attendance since 2009, attracting more than a million fans annually, according to ESPN rankings. In 2023, 1.3 million fans traveled to watch the Cowboys at AT&T Stadium and on the road.

The New York Giants placed second in 2023 for attendance, with just over 1.2 million fans.

El Pasoan Jaime Garcia created Dallas Cowboy Fan Club 915, a group with dozens of diehard fans.

While the fan club gathers in lively watch parties at local spots, Garcia said there's nothing like visiting AT&T Stadium, a visit he's made countless times.

"I refer to it as God's house because of the hole in the roof — even though it's retractable," Garcia said with a laugh. "It's a big deal to visit Jerry World — it's a billion-dollar facility."

Here's how much it could cost to watch the Dallas Cowboys play in person:

Where is the Dallas Cowboys stadium?

The $1.2 billion AT&T Stadium is in Arlington, Texas.

Where to find the 2024 Dallas Cowboys schedule

The Dallas 2024 season schedule can be found on the team's official website. It is also available as a downloadable version for printing.

More: Former Cowboys RB, Super Bowl VI champion Duane Thomas dies at 77

How much do Dallas Cowboys tickets cost?

Ticket prices vary from $25 for standing room to more than $1,000 for seats closer to the field.

Tickets went on sale in May, shortly after the NFL released the regular season schedule.

Several months later, there is only standing room available on the team's official site — and marked-up resale tickets.

For Dallas' preseason game against the Los Angeles Chargers on Aug. 24, pricing starts at $25 for standing room, and the cost nearly triples for its Thanksgiving game against the New York Giants at $65 a ticket for standing room, according to Seat Geek, the online ticket seller for the official Dallas Cowboys website.

Resale tickets get a little tricker to find — and pricier.

Before purchasing, Ticketmaster warns ticket prices may be higher than face value. The listing price is determined by the seller, which includes fans, season ticket holders, and professional resellers, according to its website.

Tickets for the Cowboys' first preseason game cost $662 for seats near the field and $150 or more for seats in the middle of the stadium.

For more popular games — like Dallas' Thanksgiving game — fans will pay between $1,000 and $1,300 per ticket for seats near the field, while sections towards the back of the stadium cost an average of about $250.

This doesn't include those resale fees, which include a service fee, order processing fee, delivery fee and facility fee.

How much will airfare cost?

As most flyers know, airfare can vary drastically depending on the flight's month, day and time.

On the travel website Expedia, a roundtrip from El Paso to Dallas in August, September, or October could cost travelers upwards of $300 roundtrip per person, while prices around Thanksgiving cost more than $400 on average.

Hotels near AT&T Stadium

The good news for Dallas fans is that there are several hotels around AT&T Stadium, and nightly rates seem to be stable throughout the year.

Prices range from about $60 a night at nearby Motel 6 — only a five-minute walk from the stadium — to just over $200 a night at the Loews Arlington Hotel and Convention Center, also within walking distance.
